subject: Re: [junit] Re: possibility to run some tests from separate files
msgSnippet: Can you raise a feature request on http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues?  Thanks, David Saff On Sat, Dec 12, 2009 at 3:11 AM, cybernetics.core
messageBody:
Can you raise a feature request on
http://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues? Thanks,

David Saff

On Sat, Dec 12, 2009 at 3:11 AM, cybernetics.core
<cybernetics.core@...> wrote:
> Unfortunatelly we need the solution, without making any changes to code.
> For example - with the new release of some application we run only tests, that have failed in past version.
>
> Thanks for help!
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> Dmitry,
>>
>> I'm not aware of an existing GUI that would do what you want.  There
>> are ways to get it done in code: are you interested in those, or does
>> it need to be a GUI solution?
>>
>>    David Saff
>>
>> On Fri, Dec 11, 2009 at 3:07 AM, cybernetics.core
>> <cybernetics.core@...> wrote:
>> > Hello, *!
>> >
>> > A short introduction before question:
>> > Let's say we are having a different test case files - one for each category, for example
>> >
>> > AmFM.java
>> >    test_AmFmTest1()
>> >    test_AmFmTest2()
>> >    test_AmFmTest3()
>> > Antenna.java
>> >    test_Antenna1()
>> >    test_Antenna2()
>> > Video.java
>> >    test_Video1()
>> >    test_Video2()
>> >    test_Video3()
>> >
>> >
>> > And the question is:
>> > Is there any possibility to test only some tests from each file, without creating temperatery file (through some GUI with lightbulbes for example?)
>> >
>> > Here is example of what we need:
>> > test_AmFmTest3()
>> > test_Antenna1()
>> > test_Video2()
>> > test_Video3()
>> >
>> >
>> > Is saw the Category option in Junit 4.8 releasenotes, but unfortunatelly it is not the solution - we must not change much code or create new files for this group of tests.
>> >
>> > Thank you and you are great!,
>> > Dmitriy.
